Articles.Content:
Based on the technologies developed for my U-boats, I built a dual hull submarine with armor and stable handling. It also has an armored hangar on the deck, along with a nice fuel load of 13,000 units and a cruising speed of 12.6 m/s at 40-200 meters depth.

She weighs about 700 tons and is almost 60 meters long. XD















The hull bottom is just more armor.


It can dive rather deep.

Edited January 13, 2016 by andrew123

That's awesome! One of these days I'll have to try my hand at subs..

Are the ore tanks calibrated so the sub's the same density as the water?
Very nice! Although the fins halfway ... can't remember seeing them in the schematic.

[quote name='Azimech']Very nice! Although the fins halfway ... can't remember seeing them in the schematic.[/QUOTE]

It was to help with handling. I'm going to take them off to see how it performs. XD

TBH, it's kinda hard to make workable submarines in KSP without deviating from the original a bit. Doesn't mean we shouldn't try it.
Looks nice! Can't wait to see the planes you make for it! Do you have plans for a catapult to launch aircraft or to just launch them unaided?
I can't even get my sub to submerge
